column5: Sad story but incredible images and a once in a life time photo op  http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/whale-carcasses-in-newfoundland-seen-in-dramatic-images-after-washing-ashore-1.1795035
my thoughts exactly ....im thinking it will be a little more potent than a few old salmon on the side of the bank...i wonder if they will explode it with dynamite like they do in the good ole USA
I cant understand why they dont just pull it back out to sea and detonate it  http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/rotting-whale-s-stench-bloating-worry-trout-river-1.2624297?cmp=fbtl

I was listening to an official last night on cbc radio... The problem is the whale is beached above the high tide line, it will require an excavator to push the whale off the rocks. It will also require a large ship, the whale is estimated at 180 tonnes, this is a small community that survives on some tourist dollars, they don't have the means or the budget to handle something like this....  Quite the quandary.... Only thing I can think of is federal fisheries or a provincial body to step in and offer funding....  People are climbing this mammal, taking pics etc.. I don't like most people.  G
yeah ...kinda reminds me of when James Brown died....i still think they are passing his carcass around for photo ops
Advice for Newfoundland: Don't do this.  "Those in charge will not only remember what to do, they'll certainly remember what not to do"  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xBgThvB_IDQ
Wow that's huge.  Rod that video had me in stitches  lol

Ministry of natural resources do not mind making money off of something they do not own....so they should step up to the plate and take care of this ....remind me why people pay taxes again?????  http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/newfoundlanders-fear-rotting-whale-carcasses-could-soon-explode-1.1797195   you'll get a bang out of this one..  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dCsMNurn3bQ
